title: Cattaraugus County-Olean Airport
text:
Cattaraugus County-Olean Airport is a city-owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located 10 <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (12 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 19 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) north of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Olean%2C%20New%20York">Olean</a>, a city in <a href="Cattaraugus%20County%2C%20New%20York">Cattaraugus County, New York</a>, United States. It is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Cattaraugus County-Olean Airport covers an area of 426 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (172 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 2,135 feet (651 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has two <a href="runway">runway</a>s: 4/22 is 4,800 by 100 feet (1,463 x 30 m) with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface; 16/34 is 2,135 by 100 feet (651 x 30 m) with a <a href="grass">turf</a> surface.
For the 12-month period ending July 9, 2009, the airport had 25,550 aircraft operations, an average of 70 per day: 98% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>, 2% <a href="air%20taxi">air taxi</a>, and <1% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>. At that time there were 12 aircraft based at this airport: 92% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> and 8% multi-engine.
Olean has had airline service in the past, including local service carrier <a href="Mohawk%20Airlines">Mohawk Airlines</a>. In 1968, Mohawk served Olean 2 flights a day using Fairchild FH 227 equipment. One flight went to Jamestown, NY, continuing on to Cleveland and the other flight went to Syracuse.
